name: Tortworth Court Four Pillars Hotel

reviews.text: I recently stayed here with my fiance, in-laws and "nan-in-law" for a Murder Mystery Weekend. The hotel itself is a magical country mansion with vast amounts of open space; which makes you want to be a child again and run around! The rooms are spacious, beds comfortable and bathroom spotless. It really was very exciting when we arrived as it gave us an impression of what our 2 night stay would be like = relaxing and classy.
reviews.title: Absolutely stunning!!!!!! (...however there is a "but"...)

reviews.text: However, the service at breakfast/dinner is what I can only describe as "frantic". I am unsure as to whether they are short staffed, but the tables weren't cleared in good time and every other waiter who went into the kitchen dropped everything so it was quite noisy. In addition, at the morning breakfast buffet, when you are given a table and go up to get your food, don't be surprised if they haven't given your table to someone else as you weren't sitting there. They got confused at dinner one evening because I ordered the duck, 15 minutes later I was told they didn't have any. I didn't like anything else on the menu (literally) and he went to fetch me the menu again just in case. When he returned, he told me that they had "found some duck now" - not sure where?! It was cooked to absolute perfection and was delicious! Also, I had to ask for a glass of wine 3 times and it eventually arrived about 30 minutes later (small when I ordered large).
reviews.title: Good value for money not sure about 4 stars...
Disappointing
reviews.text: The swimming pool - which is described as "RELAXING" is far from it. It is boiling hot in the room and anyway, you can't swim because of the amount of screaming children in there with their parents watching on as they jump on your head while you're trying to "relax". It doesn't matter whether you go in there at 8am or 8pm, they're everywhere!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Orangery is stunning BUT, if you do the Murder Mystery you are in there from 3pm until 10.30pm (with a 2 hour break) and if the sun is out, you may actually melt into the foundations. They didn't provide enough cooling devices and so the first 4 hours were frankly unbearable. But, after several gentle "rages" our table of 8 was given a little fan to sit on the floor. The actors were fantastic and they really made you feel like you were actually in the 1920's and right in amongst the plot!
reviews.title: Wasted Potential

reviews.text: Anyway, all in all, I WOULD DEFINITELY GO BACK but I would try and go when the occupancy was lower to avoid children as we couldn't relax as much as we would have liked to.
reviews.title: Not disabled friendly

reviews.text: A friend and I decided to splash out a bit to stay here and loved it. Food was great, grounds and building were amazing! I definitely want to come back here sometime and stay longer!
reviews.title: Beautiful place!

reviews.text: I recently stayed on a business trip for 4 nights... I loved the building and the surrounding, facilities are very good with a well equipped gym, pool, jacuzzi, steam room and sauna- very impressive. Staff are friendly enough and helpful with any questions you have... Thebiggest down fall was the food and resturant... Food isn't what it is described to be on the menu - ie 'home cut chips' are frozen and soggy... :-( not nice with a steak. You must make reservations in the resturant- no walk in. I couldn't get a table until 8:45 when I asked at 6:30... Ended up at the local pub for dinner on my last night which as soo much better and half the price... All in all... Great hotel- but I would eat else-where.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel and surroundings- poor food.

reviews.text: We have just come home from my sons wedding at Tortworth we can not thank everyone here enough for making this day so special. We arrived Friday checked in no problem room was large and lovely the wedding was so lovely and intimate in the orangery and then the marquee which looked stunning .The grounds are gorgeous and the pictures we have got are amazing also want to mention the hairdressers kopperz they made us all look stunning and were so welcoming ,
reviews.title: Fab Wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were staying as a couple for 2 nights for a wedding at the nearby Berkeley Castle. The "Connoisseur" room's decor was tired, the carpet faded and dirty and the bathroom was ancient. Sound insulation was poor with noisy airconditioning units outside. The windows were filthy. My evening meal on the first night was inedible (gristly roast pork, smelly veg & when I asked for crackling, I was told there wasn't any, even though this was supposed to be their "roast of the day"). The wine, a Meursalt at £36, was very poor quality. On the second day, I tore my finger open on the shower, which had a metal spike sticking out of the temperature control. I was brought a sticking plaster and received 10% discount off the room bill. The hotel gets one star for the friendly staff and the gorgeous arboretum, but at £360 for two nights, even after a 10% discount and my evening meal refunded, this was far too expensive. This is not a 4 star hotel and the owners need to invest in the quality of food and interior before charging these ridiculous prices. At the wedding, we met a few locals who said that the hotel has rapidly gone downhill in quality over the last year or so...I would not bother staying here again, though it is worth a visit for the lovely grounds and arboretum. The nearby Best Western is much better quality and value for money.
reviews.title: Poor food, dangerous fittings, expensive rooms

reviews.text: I stayed here with a friend on a pamper break. We paid a little extra and had eve meal in orangery ,this meal was amazing.
reviews.title: Lovely quiet get away

reviews.text: Spent 4 days at this hotel and thought it was great. They do package deals that include dinner and I cannot fault the value - you would have to look hard to find accom and food and good quality rooms to better this. Staff were great. Spa - have to say is not a great size, but atleast there is a small pool and gym. Hotel grounds fantastic and location not too far from motorway if you want to travel onwards but its also close to lots of open countryside. Some other reviewers have noted slow service but in the four days we had one instance where the starter for our meal took ages to come but the satff were very apologetic and in all honesty we just enjoyed the dinning room and chatted whilst we waited. We were on hols so why rush? The rooms were spotless and cleaned well every day. Would def recommend this place for a package deal.
reviews.title: Great 4 day break

reviews.text: This is a very pretty country house hotel set in ample grounds. The Victorian features are impressive as is the local cuisine. Also has a spa which is a plus for those wanting maximum relaxation. I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys lounging around and good food.
reviews.title: Beautiful and good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last week we shared a beautiful summer break at Tortworth Court. the standard of Service was excellent and courtesy and friendliness were particularly good. We are thinking of coming again.
reviews.title: Beautiful Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is convenient for the M5 motorway and it was easy to find. However, it is confusing on leaving to get back to the M5 and a couple of well placed directional signs would help!
reviews.title: Great Value Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stay here several times on the bed , breakfast & dinner offer. The rooms are always clean and well decorated .
reviews.title: Impressive building and grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has a very lovely entrance and the reception area was well staffed so we could go quickly to our room. Having specified a room in the main house (despite booking on a 'deal'), we had a lovely view over the stone parapet over the grounds at the front and the beautiful atrium. The room (standard) wasn't large but had lovely period beaming and an alcove window - very romantic.
reviews.title: Beautiful building, full of romance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was varied although the staff were very busy all the food was well cooked. We had a lovely table by the window in the library but the books had been bought by the metre, so there were some odd combinations on the shelves. Dinner was also good with enough choice to suit my picky vegetarian partner.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel in country setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the second day we went for breakfast in a beautiful covered courtyard, which was much more chilled than the main dining room - seek it out on the Sunday if you can. Also take a drink and find your way to the room at the top of the house - wonderful views and many comfy sofas - it could easily have been commercialised into a space to make money from you but it's been left as a quiet retreat for whoever finds it. There are also a choice of bar areas, inc one with TV/pool and one without so you can choose what sort of atmosphere you'd like.
reviews.title: A Lovely Hide Away

reviews.text: I should imagine it's a lovely place to get married, but the wedding didn't interfere with our stay at all, which was appreciated.
reviews.title: very surprised

reviews.text: We were very happy with our stay as a couple, but I'd have felt happy coming here with my children too.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but avoid rooms 15 & 17

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights here after getting a great deal through Travelzoo. The first thing that strikes you as you arrive is how stunning the building is and its location. It has beautiful grounds which are well maintained as are the public areas. All of the staff are friendly and very helpful. Our room was acceptable but certainly not up to 4 star standards. As I understand it the hotel was renovated in 2000 and unfortunately this shows in the rooms. They are now looking tired. The bed was uncomfortable. The bath was badly chipped and the furniture rough around the edges. We had a room in the main house so maybe others are better? The dinner was acceptable at best but certainly not fine dining. Most dishes I could have produced myself and I'm no chef. On the first night I had duck breast and wasn't asked how I wanted it cooked. It came well done which was a shame as it seemed a good quality piece of meat but tough. On the second night we had 'roast of the day' which the menu boasts is served with 'all the trimmings'. The meat was pork (which was very nice) but with 3 tough reheated potatoes and some veg. 'All the trimmings' to me should mean at least some crackling and apple sauce.
reviews.title: Acceptable but could be stunning

reviews.text: Would I go back? Probably, if the price was right as this is a comfortable hotel in a stunning location, but it could be so much better.
reviews.title: Perfect weekend away.
Beautiful setting
reviews.text: Each year my wife and I spend a weekend away with friends, meeting "half way" (between Wales and Kent) and hopefully in a decent hotel. This year's meet was held at Tortworth and what a great choice! The package was affordable (DBB £320 per couple) and everything about the weekend was perfect- a fabulous setting, food was excellent as was the ambience, and a special mention for the staff all of whom really know how to make a stay very, very pleasurable indeed.

We stayed at the hotel on our way down to Weymouth. Check in was fast, and we found all the staff we into contact with very polite. Our room was large and overlooked the front door ( and Gargoils) Dinner and breakfast were served in the old library, complete with magnificent fireplace. The food was excellent with ample of choice. The pool and spa looked inviting, but we weren't there long enough to sample them. The grounds are well kept and well worth a stroll around them. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend Tortworth Court.
reviews.title: A peaceful and relaxing stay

reviews.text: The hotel has a spacious outside seating area were you can enjoy the view of the gardens. The staff were friendly and courteous. My room was more than adequate, it was spacious enough with a double bed, a desk with chair and two relaxing chairs as well as lamps and reading lights on each side of the bed and a small(ish) tv on the wall showing freeview channels. The bathroom includes a bath and a shower. The evening meal (I was on a b+b & evening meal deal) gives you a choice of about 4 starts, mains and desserts - you can upgrade to certain items (ie steak was on offer for an additional £6-7), the also have wine menu ranging from £18-37 per bottle. The breakfast is a buffet of both continental and full English. I paid £108 for one nights accommodation with evening meal and breakfast and I enjoyed it.
reviews.title: preston man

reviews.text: Seems to have had a remarkable renovation this old stately home and returned to its former glory. The main building is quite stunning, rooms with high ceilings and stately trappings and well maintained on the whole. The service was quick and efficient though my starter and main did make it to the table before my glass of wine. Food in the restaraunt was very good quality. A set menu was operating on an £19 two course or £25 three course option. I did love my blackpudding/poached egg/hollandaise starter and I can highly recommned it. I made the mistake of assuming that "the Special" - rump steak and hand cut chips at £9.95 supplement to the set charge would be as special as the additional price would suggest and was sadly let down. It was nicely cooked but certainly didnt deserve the additional cost above the other mains. Other than that i didnt get chance to use the leisure facilities which did look very good. Theres plenty of parking available. Wireless internet is available through swisscom but at the usual extortionate hotel rates I managed a weak 3 signal for my USB stick by the bedroom window. Overall - a grand old place with great character, clean and well run but perhaps not the best of value for food but i would certainly go back again.
reviews.title: Affordable Grandeur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a very enjoyable weekend at Tortworth Court, as you approach the hotel down the driveway you feel this is a quality place, the grounds are lovely and the outside of the hotel very impressive. The inside of Tortworth did not let it down it was very clean and the reception staff very polite and helpfull. We stayed in room 41 a connoisseur room, which had ample room for us and again very clean. The bed was very comfy and we both had a great nights sleep.
reviews.title: relaxing weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The meals in Moretons where again very good, and all the restaurant staff very good and helpfull.
reviews.title: Relaxing weekend with hubby

reviews.text: Bar prices are not cheap ( £8 for a tia maria and coke and a pint of lager) but i have a paid a lot more at other hotels.
reviews.title: Four Stars, I don't think so!‎

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a swim inthe pool and and then went in the sauna and steam room, again i must say the standard of cleanliness was excellent.
reviews.title: Great Hotel,Great Food, Great Weekend.

reviews.text: This really seemed like two hotels in one - a Victorian gothic main house with character and a completely modern two storey large block tacked on at the rear. There are around 40 rooms in the main house and 100 in the modern blocks to the rear. We opted to pay an extra £20 per night and stay in a "Connoisseur"" room in the main house and got a large, high ceiling pleasant room. Some family members stayed in the modern blocks and all complained of unpleasantly hot rooms with all the character of a motel.
reviews.title: A tale of two hotels

reviews.text: The other weakness of this hotel is its restaurant - important because it is stuck out in the country. The dinner is average but acceptable just. The breakfast is buffet style and resembles a scrum on busy weekend mornings.
reviews.title: Just Beautiful

reviews.text: Overall it's OK - but just OK.
reviews.title: Nice grounds and hotel but a hot room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very lovely hotel set in beautiful ground at an idyllic location.
reviews.title: We had a fantastic stay

reviews.text: From the moment we drove up to the hotel we knew we were going to love this hotel and it did not disappoint in any way.
reviews.title: Great building, relaxing stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Can find no fault with this amazing hotel, from the moment we arrive3d we found the staff charming and helpful, the room was lovely, clean and fabulous view over the3 gardens. The Orangery is a treat and the staff particularly John were attentive and thoughtful. The spa area although small was very clean and again can find no fault. A must for anyone looking for old fashioned values and manners and comfort and tranquility. The food equally as good. Cannot wait to return.
reviews.title: wonderful

reviews.text: From the moment you turn off the road into the drive you have the feeling of being somewhere special and that's just what our break was, special. We booked a two night spa break including breakfast, dinner and a spa treatment.
reviews.title: A perfect break

reviews.text: We arrived very early but were given a very warm welcome by all the reception staff, we went for a walk in the beautiful grounds until the manager told us that the room was ready, long before the appointed time, The room was very plush, comfortable and spotlessly clean with a fabulous view through the turrets to the arboretum, we were met by spectacular autumn hues. The dining room is very grand and although full was surprisingly quiet, there was a gentle hum of people talking but no need to shout to be heard, the food was delicious and the service excellent, the menu in Moreton's is quite limited but offers a very good selection to meet all tastes, I was also impressed by the vegetarian dishes, obviously prepared with some thought behind them. Although the staff are mostly young they are very well trained and they all look happy and pleased to serve you, they were also very attentive to their customers should they require anything.
reviews.title: Tremendous Tortworth!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious, a great selection of fresh fruits and cereals, yoghurts etc., perfectly cooked hot fried eggs with runny yolks, not easy when catering for so many, the food was constantly replenished so everything was always hot and fresh. What did surprise me was the number of beautifully behaved children at dinner and breakfast, not a peep out of them. [half term] I was also surprised at how quiet that hotel was in the evening even though it was full we didn't hear a sound in our room.
reviews.title: Tortworth Court delivers its promise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The leisure facilities were very good, modern and clean and the treatments in the beauty salon first class. All in all an excellent stay. There are plenty of pretty villages in the area and the hotel has information on the many places of interest to visit. When we left I remarked to the Manageress how well we had been treated by all the staff, her reply was "You can have a beautiful building but it's the people who work in it that make a good stay" she was absolutely right.
reviews.title: Beautiful Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our weekend stay here was very nice. The hotel setting is fantastic with a great building and lovely grounds. Its location near to Bristol is great for visitors who want both the country and city within their visit.
reviews.title: A Good Hotel Set in a Beautiful Building

reviews.text: We stayed at Tortworth Court for a family celebration of my Grandparents' 67th wedding anniversary. The restaurant staff were given no prior notice of this; however on discovering that we were celebrating the anniversary, the Manager, Tatiana, took it upon herself to arrange a hand-written card from the hotel and special celebration desserts with candles for my grandparents! This was very impressive given that they had a large wedding party the night before and had served 360 covers at breakfast! Tatiana was full of enthusiasm and made us feel very welcome and comfortable. We would definitely recommend the hotel for its excellent customer service. It is a beautiful place to stay as well.
reviews.title: Very impressive customer service and a beautiful place to stay!

reviews.text: As we were aware that there could be functions taking place we requested a quiet room. There were a number of weddings taking place, both on the Saturday and Sunday, with associated revels late into the evening. The room we were given was well away from the main reception area and we were completely undisturbed by any noise from the partying! The staff were all very friendly and efficient - the exception being a rather brusque receptionist when we tried to check-in at 3 pm - the check-in time is apparently 4 pm! The majority of hotels have more flexibility and will check to see if your room is ready - rather than just saying "Check-in at 4 pm!"
reviews.title: A great weekend!

reviews.text: I came here for a weekend with a friend for a girlie catch-up time. We loved the hotel, the ambience, the grounds and most of all the friendliness of the staff. We had a really relaxing time and enjoyed the spa facilities as well as the grounds for sitting out in, sipping lattes and chatting. The staff were so helpful and friendly and all took time to chat to us. Nothing was too much trouble. It was definitely the friendliest hotel I have been to in the UK. Other hotels could learn from their level of customer service. Although the food wasn't top notch, the ambience of the restaurants and the service more than made up for it. I highly recommend it for a weekend getaway.
reviews.title: Lovely relaxing weekend

reviews.text: A surprise night out with some friends at Tortworth Court was great fun for all. Great night, good food, good entertainment & a night in a great hotel.
reviews.title: Madonna tribute night

reviews.text: I found this hotel on laterooms on a good offer at £79.00 inc Breakfast.
reviews.title: I found a gem.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its in an ideal spot for the M4, M5 and Bristol but is quiet and quite exclusive. Although the hotel is large and easy to get lost going to your room, the room is worth it. Nicely decorated and spacious with all mod cons.
reviews.title: Disappointing - Needs Improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I ate in the Orangery which is fine dining but not expensive. The service was excellent and the food was fabulous. I intend to use this hotel again when next in the area.
reviews.title: Cant work out Tortworth court

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well done guys and thanks.
reviews.title: one of the nicest places to be in the south west

reviews.text: Driving in to Tortworth and indeed standing in the reception area you think you might be in for an excellent, character filled stay. Unfortunately from the moment you enter your room you realise this is not the case. Although the rooms are of a good size they are very tired. The bed was quite hard, the television was a very old ‘square’ tv with very few channels, the bathroom extremely small and dated and the sanitary wear was dull and rusting brown from age. The general decor was not in keeping with the building nor was it contemporary – just dated.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positive -
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel but disappointing service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a good deal through Travelzoo and stayed for a few days a Tortworth Court. The area is very peaceful and the location is perfect as a romantic getaway. The hotel and grounds are beautiful and very impressive in all its grandeur. Our room was very nice and we were pleased as they had granted our request to have a room in the main part of the house. The spa was small but lovely, it was very quiet when we went (during the week) and well run. Our favourite part of the trip was our day in the spa and wandering around the beautiful gardens and the arboretum.
reviews.title: Great Deal

reviews.text: Negative -
reviews.title: Great venue for business workshop

reviews.text: We travelled by public transport which was probably a bad idea as we had a nightmare journey and it was very difficult to get to (involving, trains, buses and cabs!) despite being told it would be easy, so would definitely recommend driving. After having a horrible journey we arrived to a very unfriendly check in and rude receptionist. We were looking forward to a decent meal, but although the dining room is lovely, the ambience was all wrong and the food quality was far below what we expected for somewhere like this. The waiters were friendly but the bar staff were very unhelpful as they did not seem to speak much English, so there were a few problems ordering due to the language barrier. Our room was clean but there was no air con so it was extremely hot, and our towels were not replaced at all (instead were hung back up still wet) despite us staying there for a few days.
reviews.title: Fantastic Tortworth Court
Good but could be better
reviews.text: The general service we experienced did not fit with the expectations of such a grand and luxurious looking hotel; in this respect it was very disappointing.

A truely wonderful experience. Although we only stayed for only one night we regret not having booked for longer. We had two rooms one in the 'original' building and one in the new part. They both were very comfortable and clean with welcoming bottles of red and white wine. As I have got older (62) I have become much less tolerent of poor service etc. but here the staff could not be faulted, helpful and enthusiastic, even recommending places to visit on our way to our next destination. The restaurant service and food was also way above expectations and the staff (east european?) lively, bouncy and so obliging not what we have grown to expect of late. The hotel 'building' and its grounds are beyond my ability to describe and do it the justice it deserves, so I can only recommend you visit their website.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, terrific setting. Recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would we visit again - without hesitation!
reviews.title: Its a pity we had to leave
Relaxing weekend in an impressive setting
reviews.text: The only 'problem' was that we booked a double and a twin room in the main/old building but the usual problem of dealing with 'central reservations', they didnt seem to know that there were no twin rooms in that part of the hotel but the reception staff quickly & immediately corrected the situation to our complete satisfaction perhaps I should have done as I normally do and only book direct with the hotel itself, lesson reinforced.

reviews.title: ideal location for a new episode of "The Office"
reviews.text: I only hope that the Four Pillars Hotel group maintain this standard throughout all their hotels, as based on this one we have already booked for an extended stay over the Christamas break.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To celebrate our wedding anniversary, my husband and I booked into the Tortworth Court hotel for a long weekend. When we phoned to make the booking, the staff were very helpful and friendly and this continued during our stay. Our room was quite a way from the main reception but we could park the car close by and this wasn't a problem for us at all. The swimming pool and spa pool were fabulous and very relaxing but unfortunatley it was not possible to have any spa treatments as they were already fully booked - a little disappointing. The general appearance was excellent, everything was clean and tidy, the grounds were beautiful and the staff friendly. The grounds would of been nicer if a country walk could be followed out of the main grounds. The food however was the biggest high spot for us, as being wheat intollerant eating out is a nightmare for me. However all the menus depicted what food I could eat and staff were very helpful with this as well. Overall a fantastic break which was much needed and much enjoyed.
reviews.title: The Facts not the Fiction about this Stunning hotel

description: This magnificent Cotswolds country house hotel is situated in a stunning South Gloucestershire location, conveniently near to Bristol. A grade II* listed Victorian mansion, Tortworth Court Four Pillars Hotel offers all the grandeur of an elegant Cotswold's hotel alongside the hotel facilities of a premier four star hotel.
